reviews.review_msg: Lectures were boring, his instructions on the assignment are not clear, way too broad. His grading scale is different from the other profs, lower for grades. Very organized, always changing the details of the assignments without telling the students. Hard to reach, and is not accessible for extra help.

I don't get why she's so confused that no one shows up. Classes are dry because she reads off a paper and plays videos for lectures, and she has a really negative off putting attitude. She gives minimal, unhelpful feedback and relies on students to drive the entire course. I feel like I've learned nothing new.

Patterson outlines her expectations very clearly in the first class. Doing the readings will heavily influence your grade, and class participation is not only required but something she enjoys. The essays are fairly open, and she is available for help and consultation. CHECK YOUR EMAIL, she sometimes cancels class last minute.

Natasha is very difficult to work with. She often dismisses questions that can supposedly be answered "in the syllabus" when it is not. Her lectures are very scripted rather than natural, so it feels like I'm watching a presentation. She is on the harsher side of grading and often has an offputting or condescending attitude. I would not recommend.

Knowledgeable, but hard to approach. Tough grader and doesn't leave constructive feedback, comments are often vague and unhelpful. Cancels class last minute, expects students to be able to accommodate to constantly changing schedule. Would not recommend it to students who have heavy courseloads, or are looking to take her class for extra credit.

As a GSWS major and someone with a busy schedule outside of school, I would not recommend Natasha. She cancelled 8 classes, put 5 online and expected us to do additional last minute assignments or readings. Although some of the topics and assignments were interesting, the organization of the class was hard to follow and overall frustrating.
